key_insight: Introducing Resampling Forcing — a teacher-free, self-resampling training strategy that eliminates exposure bias in autoregressive video diffusion models by aligning training and sampling dynamics end-to-end.
problem_solved: Exposure bias caused by a train-test mismatch in autoregressive video diffusion: models trained with teacher signals fail when they must autoregressively sample at test time, requiring complex post-training fixes or teacher models.
method: Resampling Forcing: replace external teachers/discriminators with a self-resampling scheme that intermittently feeds model-generated partial trajectories back into the training loop so the model learns to recover from its own samples.

Align training and sampling distributions by simulating autoregressive sampling during training (resample frames/latents at various timesteps) and apply a forcing objective to robustify future-frame predictions.
Design the pipeline to train from scratch at scale in an end-to-end fashion, removing dependence on bidirectional teacher models or online discriminators.
impact: Makes autoregressive video diffusion simpler, more scalable, and more robust to compounding errors — enabling better long-horizon video generation and easier deployment without costly teacher models or post-training fixes.

paper_title: End-to-End Training for Autoregressive Video Diffusion via Self-Resampling
paper_authors: Yuwei Guo, Ceyuan Yang, Hao He, Yang Zhao, Meng Wei
